repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  Shada jumplist entries still include entries from e.g. 'nobuflisted' buffers.
Solution: Check `ignore_buf()` before adding jumplist entries, followup to b98eefd8.

Fix #18433

comment_data.body: Removed `unlisted ('buflisted')` from `shada-%`, as `nobuflisted` files are not stored in general.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5203,9 +5203,8 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	%	When included, save and restore the buffer list.  If Vim is
 		started with a file name argument, the buffer list is not
 		restored.  If Vim is started without a file name argument, the
-		buffer list is restored from the shada file.  Quickfix 
-		('buftype'), unlisted ('buflisted'), unnamed and buffers on 
-		removable media (|shada-r|) are not saved.
+		buffer list is restored from the shada file. Quickfix ('buftype'), 
+		unnamed and buffers on removable media (|shada-r|) are not saved.

comment_data.body:
_(Edit: I was confused, this was already documented.)_

Testing `:set shada+=%`, it looks like it is _already_ the case that `'nobuflisted'` buffers are _not_ saved/restored (check with `:ls!`). So the change in this PR actually just fixes a bug, maybe? 

Anyway, let's update the doc here:
```suggestion
	%	Save and restore the buffer list (only 'buflisted' buffers).  If Vim is
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5203,9 +5203,8 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	%	When included, save and restore the buffer list.  If Vim is

comment_data.body: Still worth mentioning explicitly I think. Let's keep the help as it was here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5203,9 +5203,8 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	%	When included, save and restore the buffer list.  If Vim is
 		started with a file name argument, the buffer list is not
 		restored.  If Vim is started without a file name argument, the
-		buffer list is restored from the shada file.  Quickfix 
-		('buftype'), unlisted ('buflisted'), unnamed and buffers on 
-		removable media (|shada-r|) are not saved.
+		buffer list is restored from the shada file. Quickfix ('buftype'), 
+		unnamed and buffers on removable media (|shada-r|) are not saved.

comment_data.body:
`|nobuflisted|` is not a valid tag, but anyway let's change this to:
```suggestion
- The buffer list (only 'buflisted' buffers).
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -920,7 +920,7 @@ The ShaDa file is used to store:
 - Marks for several files.
 - File marks, pointing to locations in files.
 - Last search/substitute pattern (for 'n' and '&').
-- The buffer list.
+- The buffer list (without |nobuflisted| buffers).

comment_data.body:
to avoid false negatives (tests that pass but shouldn't), it helps to check the reverse, so e.g. after this line add a small sanity check:


    -- Set 'buflisted', then check again.
    curbufmeths.set_option('buflisted', true)
    nvim_command('wshada! ' .. shada_fname)
    eq(..., find_file(fname))
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -262,4 +262,14 @@ describe('ShaDa support code', function()
        exc_exec('wshada'))
     meths.set_option('shada', '')
   end)
+
+  it('does not store unlisted buffer', function()
+    local fname = funcs.getcwd() .. '/file'
+    meths.set_var('__fname', fname)
+    nvim_command('silent! edit `=__fname`')
+    curbufmeths.set_option('buflisted', false)
+    nvim_command('wshada! ' .. shada_fname)
+
+    eq({}, find_file(fname))

comment_data.body:
Thanks. Makes sense to remove the double negation

9fed0afd36dfb2ade6da89d19ce08ca483033646

comment_data.body:
Okay, lets do that. 

The change is reverted by: e88fd1cb512d525d83dde3a1113335e9785f777d

comment_data.body:
- because this depends on the filesystem it can be racy. try wrapping this in `retry()` 
- please check that it fails correctly after wrapping in retry()

```suggestion
    retry(nil, 4000, function()
      eq({[7]=1, [8]=1, [10]=1}, find_file(fname)) end)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -262,4 +262,19 @@ describe('ShaDa support code', function()
        exc_exec('wshada'))
     meths.set_option('shada', '')
   end)
+
+  it('does not store unlisted buffer', function()
+    local fname = funcs.getcwd() .. '/file'
+    meths.set_var('__fname', fname)
+    nvim_command('silent! edit `=__fname`')
+    curbufmeths.set_option('buflisted', false)
+    nvim_command('wshada! ' .. shada_fname)
+
+    eq({}, find_file(fname))
+
+    -- Set 'buflisted', then check again.
+    curbufmeths.set_option('buflisted', true)
+    nvim_command('wshada! ' .. shada_fname)
+    eq({[7]=1, [8]=1, [10]=1}, find_file(fname))

comment_data.body: why silent with "!"? that silences errors...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -264,4 +264,21 @@ describe('ShaDa support code', function()
     session:close()
     os.remove('NONE')
   end)
+
+  it('does not store unlisted buffer', function()
+    skip(is_os('win'))
+
+    local fname = funcs.getcwd() .. '/file'
+    meths.set_var('__fname', fname)
+    nvim_command('silent! edit `=__fname`')

comment_data.body: there's no good reason to skip this on windows. we need to figure out why the test isn't working there
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -264,4 +264,21 @@ describe('ShaDa support code', function()
     session:close()
     os.remove('NONE')
   end)
+
+  it('does not store unlisted buffer', function()
+    skip(is_os('win'))

comment_data.body:
Hi Justin,

thanks for looking at the PR again. As mentioned in [this comment](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/21818#issuecomment-1414145819) I've disabled the test, because I couldn't figure out why the test is failing on windows.

I wanted to try, whether the test would succeed on windows after rebasing on the latest master commit - it doesn't.

I am sorry for taking your time and not properly marking this PR as Draft. ✌🏻
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -264,4 +264,21 @@ describe('ShaDa support code', function()
     session:close()
     os.remove('NONE')
   end)
+
+  it('does not store unlisted buffer', function()
+    skip(is_os('win'))

comment_data.body:
Removed `silent!`.
I've created this test by mostly copying from another one. The other one writes silently.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -264,4 +264,21 @@ describe('ShaDa support code', function()
     session:close()
     os.remove('NONE')
   end)
+
+  it('does not store unlisted buffer', function()
+    skip(is_os('win'))
+
+    local fname = funcs.getcwd() .. '/file'
+    meths.set_var('__fname', fname)
+    nvim_command('silent! edit `=__fname`')

comment_regular_data.body:
@justinmk Hi Justin, thanks for your review. Pinging you in order to get this merged :) 

I've force pushed, as there has been a conflict in news.txt, which I resolved by rebasing on latest master and adding my line in news.txt under the existing one.

Looks like the test fails on windows?

```
FAILED   test/functional\shada\shada_spec.lua @ 266: ShaDa support code does not store unlisted buffer
test/functional\shada\shada_spec.lua:278: Expected objects to be the same.
Passed in:
(table: 0x01f097385780) { }
Expected:
(table: 0x01f0973856d0) {
 *[7] = 1
  [8] = 1
  [10] = 1 }

stack traceback:
	test/functional\shada\shada_spec.lua:278: in function <test/functional\shada\shada_spec.lua:266>
```

windows CI is still failing. what's different about this test compared to others in that test file?

```
test/functional\shada\shada_spec.lua:278: retry() attempts: 133
test/functional\shada\shada_spec.lua:279: Expected objects to be the same.
Passed in:
(table: 0x02266e573058) { }
Expected:
(table: 0x02266e572fa8) {
 *[7] = 1
  [8] = 1
  [10] = 1 }

stack traceback:
	test\helpers.lua:64: in function 'retry'
	test/functional\shada\shada_spec.lua:278: in function <test/functional\shada\shada_spec.lua:266>

Hi Justin,

thanks for keeping an eye on this PR. I currently can't find the time to check why this is failing on windows. I'll come back to this probably next week.

I've marked this MR as draft for now. Sorry for all the disturbances.

> windows CI is still failing. what's different about this test compared to others in that test file?

I can't figure out why this test case fails on windows. I've checked, whether there is some os-specific logic in shada.c, but I couldn't find any. I don't have a windows machine to test with and I am kinda clueless here.

I've disabled this test on windows for now. If this is unacceptable, I am happy if anyone picks up this PR and fixes the windows testcase.

Rebased this on top of b98eefd8, which partially resolved this. Jumplist entries seem to be the last place where `ignore_buf()` should be used. That in combination with setting 'shellslash' (like the other tests do) resolved the failure for the added `shada_spec.lua` test. The other test here was already covered by the test added in b98eefd8.

labels.description: save/restore editor state: shada, context, ctx, sessions, mksession

title: feat(shada): shada should not store nobuflisted buffers
